pr_title: Fix DLS/FLS permission for the submit async search action

timeline.bodyText:
Speaking from personal preference, I think this is trying too hard to use a Matcher, and it would be more readable to use a different style.
For example, we know exactly what results are expected, so we can check the number of hits & then we can sort the hits and check that each element is what we expect it to be.
Also, I may be mistaken because all the casting of JSON is a bit hard to read, but I think you have a type mismatch here.
If hits is List<Map<String, Map<String, Object>>>
then each element is Map<String, Map<String, Object>>
but in the Matcher, you cast actual to Map<String, Object> and check that some of the values are strings.
I think hits needs to be List<Map<String, ?>> or List<Map<String, Object>>
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText:
Okay, I have polished the test code here.
I've parsed the response to the actual AsyncSearchResponse so it doesn't deal with Maps and casts, but I've kept the collection matcher which now uses CustomMatcher elements which is simpler. I like this over sorting, because I don't know how to sort results across indices, and it feels contrived.
